ENGLISH: Irrigation channels provide access to water to crops within 2 tiles. Build a water pump and connect the channels to it using pipes.
JAPANESE: 灌漑水路は周囲2タイルの作物に水を供給することができます。汲み上げポンプを作り、パイプで水路と接続してください。

NOTES: Used when the player clicks on an area they have not discovered yet
This is a made-up fantasy food

ENGLISH: This is an infamously tough bread which is so hard and practically inedible that it takes a very long time to turn mouldy. The human explorer J. A. Moffatt once described eating it as “akin to chewing gravel that has been dredged from a swamp”. Fortunately most dwarves don’t seem to mind.
JAPANESE: カビが生えることなく長期に渡って保存が可能であり、そしてまたほとんど噛み砕けないほどに堅い、悪名高いパンです。人間の探検家であるJ.A.モファットは、このパンを食べることを「沼の底から砂利を掘り出して噛むようなもの」と表現しました。幸いなことに、ほとんどのドワーフは気にすることなく食べます。

NOTES: Actually just to describe “wheat” as a foodstuff, not specifically bread

ENGLISH: Fuel is required in the production of metal, both by the {{FURNITURE.BLOOMERY_FURNACE}} and the {{FURNITURE.FORGE}}.
JAPANESE: 燃料は{{FURNITURE.BLOOMERY_FURNACE}}と{{FURNITURE.FORGE}}を用いた金属加工に必要になります。

ENGLISH: Military settlers will practice their ranged combat skills here.
A crafting station for intricate items produced by an {{PROFESSION.ARTISAN}}.
A {{PROFESSION.CHEF}} works here to turn {{RESOURCE.FLOUR.SACK.PLURAL}} into {{INGREDIENT.DOUGH}}.
JAPANESE: {{PROFESSION.CHEF}}が{{RESOURCE.FLOUR.SACK.PLURAL}}を{{INGREDIENT.DOUGH}}に加工するために必要です。

NOTES: For the baking of bread

ENGLISH: A {{PROFESSION.CHEF}} bakes loaves here using prepared {{INGREDIENT.DOUGH}}.
JAPANESE: {{PROFESSION.CHEF}}が{{INGREDIENT.DOUGH}}を焼いてパンを作るために必要です。

ENGLISH: A beer barrel is on the way

JAPANESE: ビールがなくなりました
待機中(ビールがありません)

ENGLISH: This is where fermented {{LIQUID.BEER}} is served from.
JAPANESE: 発酵した{{LIQUID.BEER}}をグラスに注ぐ注ぎ口です。

NOTES: A simple type of furnace to smelt metal from ore

ENGLISH: A {{PROFESSION.BLACKSMITH}} uses this hand-operated furnace to turn {{RESOURCE.ORE.CRUSHED.PLURAL}} and {{FUEL.SACK}} into {{MATERIAL_TYPE.METAL.ADJECTIVE}} {{RESOURCE.METAL.INGOT.PLURAL}}.
JAPANESE: {{PROFESSION.BLACKSMITH}}は{{RESOURCE.ORE.CRUSHED.PLURAL}}と{{FUEL.SACK}}を投入し、{{MATERIAL_TYPE.METAL.ADJECTIVE}} {{RESOURCE.METAL.INGOT.PLURAL}}を製錬します。

ENGLISH: This is used to construct items out of bone.
This is used to produce the final wort (unfermented beer) using {{VEGETABLE.HOPS}} and wort from the {{FURNITURE.MASH_TUN}}.
JAPANESE: {{FURNITURE.MASH_TUN}}の麦汁に{{VEGETABLE.HOPS}}を加えて加熱し、煮沸済みの麦汁(すなわち、未発酵のビール)を作ります。

ENGLISH: Fish and animal carcasses are prepared here into usable meat.
JAPANESE: 魚や動物の死体を食料に加工します。

ENGLISH: Most wooden items and tools are produced here, such as {{PRODUCT.BUCKET.PLURAL}} and {{PRODUCT.BARREL.PLURAL}}.
JAPANESE: {{PRODUCT.BUCKET.PLURAL}}や{{PRODUCT.BARREL.PLURAL}}のような木製品を加工します。

NOTES: A large metal pot for cooking (common with Halloween)

ENGLISH: A cauldron is used to serve a large quantity of soup to hungry settlers. The soup is produced in a {{ROOMS.KITCHEN}} before being moved to a {{ROOMS.FEASTING_HALL}} for serving.
JAPANESE: 入植者たちに大量のスープを提供する大釜です。{{ROOMS.KITCHEN}}で調理され、{{ROOMS.FEASTING_HALL}}に移されたものが食卓に供されます。

ENGLISH: Settlers can sit here while using the {{FURNITURE.FEASTING_TABLE}}.
This is a pile of {{RESOURCE.LOGS.PLURAL}} covered with {{MATERIAL_TYPE.EARTH}} and slowly burned to produce {{ORE.CHARCOAL.NOUN}}, which can then be used as {{FUEL.SACK}}.
JAPANESE: {{MATERIAL_TYPE.EARTH}}で覆われた{{RESOURCE.LOGS.PLURAL}}の山です。火を付けて{{ORE.CHARCOAL.NOUN}}を生産でき、{{FUEL.SACK}}として利用できます。

ENGLISH: A coke oven converts {{ORE.BITUMINOUS_COAL.NOUN}} into {{ORE.COKE.NOUN}} so that it can be used as {{FUEL.SACK}}.
JAPANESE: コークス窯は{{ORE.BITUMINOUS_COAL.NOUN}}を{{ORE.COKE.NOUN}}にすることができ、{{FUEL.SACK}}として使用できます。

NOTES: E.g. “Granite stonemason workbench”

JAPANESE: 充填されるまで待っている

ENGLISH: Waiting to be injected with mushroom spawn
JAPANESE: キノコの播種を待っている

ENGLISH: Dough can be taken from {{FURNITURE.BAKERS_WORKTOP}} to store here before entering the {{FURNITURE.BAKING_OVEN}}.
Use this to determine which items to export from the room.

NOTES: A very large table for a feast

ENGLISH: With a {{FURNITURE.CHAIR}} in place, your settlers will enjoy their meals at this table.
JAPANESE: {{FURNITURE.CHAIR}}を配置すると、入植者はこのテーブルで食事を楽しみます。

ENGLISH: This is where {{LIQUID.HOPPED_WORT}} is fermented into {{LIQUID.BEER}}.
JAPANESE: {{LIQUID.HOPPED_WORT}}を{{LIQUID.BEER}}に変えるのに必要な桶です。

ENGLISH: Neatly store away your caught fish for future cooking.
This is a crafting station for ranged weapons and ammunition.

NOTES: This is a table with a hand-operated flour mill stone on top

ENGLISH: The gristmill grinds {{VEGETABLE.WHEAT}} into {{RESOURCE.FLOUR.SACK.NOUN}} so that it can be used by a {{PROFESSION.CHEF}}.
JAPANESE: {{VEGETABLE.WHEAT}}を{{RESOURCE.FLOUR.SACK.NOUN}}にし、{{PROFESSION.CHEF}}の使用する食材にすることができる場所です。

ENGLISH: This is where a {{PROFESSION.BLACKSMITH}} works with {{MATERIAL_TYPE.METAL.ADJECTIVE}} {{RESOURCE.METAL.INGOT.PLURAL}} and {{FUEL.SACK}} to craft items and weapons.
JAPANESE: {{PROFESSION.BLACKSMITH}}が{{MATERIAL_TYPE.METAL.ADJECTIVE}} {{RESOURCE.METAL.INGOT.PLURAL}}と{{FUEL.SACK}}を使って武器や道具を作るための場所です。

ENGLISH: A hastily-dug grave for deceased settlers that can only be dug into {{MATERIAL_TYPE.EARTH}}.
JAPANESE: 死んだ入植者のための急ごしらえの墓です。{{MATERIAL_TYPE.EARTH}}にのみ掘ることができます。

ENGLISH: Visiting merchants will park their wagons here.
Use this to determine which items to import to the room.

NOTES: Simple piece of furniture in a kitchen used to hold ingredients on top of it

ENGLISH: An area to store ingredients for a {{PROFESSION.CHEF}} to cook soup.
JAPANESE: スープを作るために{{PROFESSION.CHEF}}が作業を行う場所です。

ENGLISH: A lantern provides light. This does not currently have an in-game effect.
JAPANESE: ランタンは光を提供します。今の所、ゲーム内での効果はありません。

ENGLISH: A workbench to produce leather goods like armour and waterskins.
A landmark for the {{ROOMS.TRADING_DEPOT}}. This does not currently have an in-game effect.
Used to craft textiles such as {{PRODUCT.LINEN.NOUN}} from {{RESOURCE.HEMP.FIBRE.BUNDLE.PLURAL}}.
Here brewers steep barley and then dry it out using a kiln to produce malt.
JAPANESE: 醸造者が大麦を煮た後で乾燥させ、麦芽を作るための場所です

ENGLISH: This is used to produce wort (unfermented beer) from milled malt and water.
JAPANESE: 粉砕した麦芽と水から麦汁(未発酵のビール)を作る場所です。

ENGLISH: A log that has been injected with {{INGREDIENT.MUSHROOM.SPAWN.PLURAL}} to produce several harvests of delicious, juicy mushrooms.
JAPANESE: おいしくてジューシーなキノコを栽培するために{{INGREDIENT.MUSHROOM.SPAWN.PLURAL}}を注入した丸太です。

NOTES: This is a trough of water used to immerse mushroom logs in for a period of time

ENGLISH: After innoculation, a {{FURNITURE.MUSHROOM_LOG}} is placed in this tank to “shock” the mushroom colony and encourage it to grow mushrooms.
JAPANESE: キノコを播種後、水を満たしたこのタンクに{{FURNITURE.MUSHROOM_LOG}}を置くことによってキノコのコロニーに「刺激」を与え、発生を促進します。

ENGLISH: Raw {{RESOURCE.ORE.UNREFINED.PLURAL}} is crushed to a more workable size so that it can be used in a {{FURNITURE.BLOOMERY_FURNACE}}.
JAPANESE: {{RESOURCE.ORE.UNREFINED.PLURAL}}をより小さな欠片になるまで砕き、{{FURNITURE.BLOOMERY_FURNACE}}で加工可能にするための場所です。

NOTES: A pillar used to support a roof

ENGLISH: A pillar is required to stop large mined-out areas from collapsing. An area of 7x7 tiles that have been mined without any pillars or other supports in place will eventually collapse.
JAPANESE: 柱は採掘した洞窟の天井が崩れるのを防ぐために必要です。7x7タイルより広い部屋は柱やその他の支えになるものがなければ、いずれ崩壊します。

ENGLISH: This is used to process raw {{VEGETABLE.HEMP}} into hemp fibre that can be worked into useful materials.
JAPANESE: {{VEGETABLE.HEMP}}から有用な繊維を取り出すために必要なタンクです。

NOTES: A stone tomb

ENGLISH: This elaborate stone container is the final resting place of a deceased settler.
JAPANESE: 精緻な作りの石棺です。かつて入植者であった故人はここで最後の安息を得ます。

NOTES: A table used to hold food for serving

ENGLISH: {{PRODUCT.BREAD.LOAF.PLURAL}} are placed here for serving after being baked in a {{FURNITURE.BAKING_OVEN}}.
JAPANESE: {{FURNITURE.BAKING_OVEN}}で焼いた後、{{PRODUCT.BREAD.LOAF.PLURAL}}を切り分けるために使われる台です。

ENGLISH: A bed is the best place for a comfortable night’s rest.
JAPANESE: 夜を快適に過ごすなら、ベッドが一番です。

ENGLISH: Your settlers will use this space to sleep on the floor. Not very comfortable!
JAPANESE: 入植者を眠らせる床です。寝るのに快適とは言えません！
{{PROFESSION.STONEMASON}}が{{MATERIAL_TYPE.STONE.ADJECTIVE}}を加工するために必要です。

ENGLISH: A decorative banner to denote the trading depot.
Military settlers will practice their melee combat skills here.
Provides mechanical power to other contraptions via {{PRODUCT.STONE.GEAR.PLURAL}} and shafts. Must be built adjacent to a river.
JAPANESE: {{PRODUCT.STONE.GEAR.PLURAL}}とシャフトを使って動力を引き出します。川の横に設置する必要があります。

ENGLISH: A water barrel is a place for your settlers to get a thirst-quenching drink, rather than having to find a natural water source like the river.
JAPANESE: 川のような天然の水源に行かなくても、水タルから入植者たちに水を飲ませることができます。

ENGLISH: Moves water from the river to a pipe system.
JAPANESE: 配管を使い、川の水を他の場所に移します。

ENGLISH: A well provides a source of water, but must be connected to a working pipe system.
JAPANESE: 井戸は水源になります。使用するには配管を敷設する必要があります。

ENGLISH: Provides mechanical power to other contraptions via {{PRODUCT.STONE.GEAR.PLURAL}} and shafts.
JAPANESE: {{PRODUCT.STONE.GEAR.PLURAL}}とシャフトを使って動力を引き出します。

ENGLISH: A {{PROFESSION.WOODCUTTER}} works here to turn {{RESOURCE.LOGS.PLURAL}} into {{RESOURCE.PLANKS.PLURAL}}.
JAPANESE: {{PROFESSION.WOODCUTTER}}が{{RESOURCE.LOGS.PLURAL}}を{{RESOURCE.PLANKS.PLURAL}}にするために必要な場所です。

ENGLISH: A violet-hued variety of quartz. Ancient humans believed it could magically protect them from becoming too drunk. For this reason it is not very popular in dwarven culture.
JAPANESE: 紫色のクオーツの一種です。古代の人類にとって、アメジストは泥酔を防ぐ魔術的なお守りでした。この宝石がドワーフ文化においてあまり好まれないのはそれが理由です。

ENGLISH: An opal-like gemstone which has a red to green iridescence. It is known as the “hunting stone” and amulets made from it are meant to bring good luck to a hunt.
JAPANESE: 赤と緑が目立つ虹色をした、オパールのような宝石です。「狩猟石」という名でも知られ、狩りに幸運をもたらすお守りとされています。

ENGLISH: A cyan-coloured variety of beryl. Some humans believe it offers magical protection against the dangers of the seas. This is because an ancient mage used a combination of sky and ice magic to protect trading ships during the age of darkness.
JAPANESE: 澄んだ青色のベリルです。人間の中には、この宝石が海の危険に対して魔術的保護を提供してくれると考えるものもいます。闇の時代において、とある古代の魔術師が空と氷の魔法を使って交易船を守っていたからです。

ENGLISH: Also known as red beryl, it is a very rare gemstone. It is often confused for a red-coloured emerald.
JAPANESE: レッドベリルとも呼ばれる非常に希少な宝石です。よく赤いエメラルドと間違われます。

ENGLISH: An ore of mercury which is often used in jewellery due to its deep-red hue. It is also used to produce the dye known as vermillion.
JAPANESE: 水銀の鉱石で、真紅の宝飾品として用いられます。また、赤い染料を得るためにも使われます。

ENGLISH: A yellowish variety of quartz. It is the gemstone most similar in colour to gold, so most dwarves think citrine is lucky.
JAPANESE: 黄色みを帯びたクオーツの一種です。金と似た色の宝石であるために、ほとんどのドワーフにとってシトリンは幸運の象徴です。

ENGLISH: The hardest known material and one of the most important of the seven heavenly stones. Diamonds are the most condensed form of the neutral element known as “spirit” or “aether”.
JAPANESE: 知られている中でもっとも硬い物質であり、宝石の中でもっとも重要な七天石のひとつです。ダイヤモンドは"スピリット"もしくは"エーテル"と呼ばれるとらえどころのない物質の、その最も凝縮された形であると考えられています。

ENGLISH: A vibrant green variety of beryl. It is thought that engraving on an emerald brings great misfortune. Emeralds are closely related to elemental life and associated magic.
JAPANESE: 鮮やかな緑のベリルです。エメラルドの彫刻は大不幸をもたらすと考えられています。エメラルドは元素としての生命、そして魔法と深い関わりがあります。

ENGLISH: Garnets cover a variety of minerals used as gemstones, all with a deep red colour. Some garnet gems are actually a condensed form of elemental fire.
JAPANESE: ガーネットは深い赤色をしたさまざまな宝石の総称です。ガーネットのうちのいくつかは、実際には火の元素が凝縮されたものです。

ENGLISH: A mineral with a light-green colour often used for decoration. Also, elves have been known to use jade to produce medicine which can cure ailments of the gut.
JAPANESE: 装飾品として広く用いられている明るい緑色の鉱石です。エルフは翡翠を使って腸の病気に効く薬を作ることが知られています。

ENGLISH: An impure variety of silica which can occur in several colours, but most commonly red. Jasper is favoured as a decoration material by orcs due to its variety.
JAPANESE: 不純物の混じった石英で、いくつか色の異なる種類を持ちますが一般的には赤色です。ジャスパーはさまざまな色味のために、オークの装飾品として好まれます。

ENGLISH: A rock which shines with a typically light-blue iridescence. Rarer specimens can reflect a wide range of colours.
JAPANESE: ぱっと見には淡い青色をした、真珠のように輝く石です。ごくまれに、光の反射によって様々な色に変わるものがあります。

ENGLISH: A rock with a brilliant deep blue hue which is used as a precious stone.
JAPANESE: 貴石として使われる、美しい濃青色を持つ石です。

ENGLISH: A mineral which can be polished into beads for use in jewellery. These beads can by dyed into many different colours.
JAPANESE: 宝飾品としてビーズに加工される石です。これらのビーズは染料を用いて、さまざまな色で染められます。

ENGLISH: Thought to be formed by moonlight captured in rock, which makes this gemstone a favourite of the elves.
JAPANESE: 月光を浴びた石が変質するものであると考えられています。エルフが好む宝石です。

ENGLISH: A rose-coloured variety of beryl. It was named after being popularised by a particularly wealthy merchant in the age of myth.
JAPANESE: バラ色のベリルです。神話の時代、特に富裕な商人にちなんで名付けられました。

ENGLISH: A form of silica infused with the magic of the oceans, which makes this a favourite of sailors and fishermen.
JAPANESE: 石英の一種であり、海の魔法が込められているとされています。船員や漁師が好みます。

ENGLISH: A very rare gemstone which is often identified as an off-colour sapphire. The crystals are naturally hexagonal in shape and a favourite of tacticians.
JAPANESE: 非常に希少価値の高い宝石で、しばしばくすんだ色のサファイアと誤認されます。その結晶は自然に六角形を形成し、戦術家に好まれます。

ENGLISH: Found in varying shades of red to pink. It is not as hard as most gemstones making it a poor choice for rings and other high-impact jewellery.
JAPANESE: 赤だったりピンクだったり、様々な色合いを持つ宝石です。他の宝石に比べて硬度が低く、指輪などの傷つきかねない宝飾品に使うのは良い考えではありません。

ENGLISH: The purest form of quartz. Rock crystals often feature in magical artifacts as they are a condensed form of the element of ice.
JAPANESE: 最も純粋な石英です。ロッククリスタルは凝縮された氷の元素であると考えられており、魔法のアーティファクトによく用いられます。

ENGLISH: One of the seven heavenly stones, rubies are the element of fire condensed into a solid form.
JAPANESE: 七天石の一つ、ルビーは固体となった火の元素です。

ENGLISH: Often believed to protect the wearer from the attention of daemons, sapphires are much sought-after by mages for use in sky and air-based magic.
JAPANESE: サファイアを身に着けている者は悪魔から身を守れると広く信じられています。また空や空気に関連する魔法と関わりがあるため、魔法使いに大きな需要があります。

ENGLISH: Often confused with heavenly stones like true rubies and sapphires, spinels are a lesser form of magic-infused gem which can be associated with any of the elements, depending on colour.
JAPANESE: よくルビーやサファイアのような天石と混同されていますが、スピネルは色に応じてさまざまな元素を表す弱い魔法が込められた石です。

ENGLISH: A rare gemstone that can alternate between blue and violet. It is thought to be formed from the material body of a dead god.
JAPANESE: 青色と紫色の間を行き来する、希少価値の高い宝石です。死神から身を守ることができると考えられています。

ENGLISH: Sometimes confused with the more common {{GEM.CITRINE.NOUN}} gem, topaz can be found in several colours but most commonly a yellowish brown. It was first discovered on an island which no longer exists.
JAPANESE: ときどきより一般的な{{GEM.CITRINE.NOUN}}と混同されますが、トパーズはいくつかの色を持つものの普通は黄色がかった茶色です。この宝石が最初に発見された島は、もはや存在しません。

ENGLISH: Often found alongside {{ORE.CASSITERITE.ADJECTIVE}} ore. It is sometimes associated with earth magic.
JAPANESE: {{ORE.CASSITERITE.ADJECTIVE}}鉱石に混じって発見されることの多い宝石です。大地の魔法に関連付けられることがあります。

ENGLISH: Your settlement no longer has a {{TOOL.PLANE}} available. This is required to construct wooden furniture.

ENGLISH: As well as occuring naturally as {{ORE.NATIVE_COPPER.NOUN}}, it is also easy to smelt from {{ORE.MALACHITE.NOUN}} ore. Copper has many uses, particularly in coinage, though it is not hard enough to create effective weapons.
JAPANESE: 銅は{{ORE.NATIVE_COPPER.NOUN}}として自然に存在し、あるいは{{ORE.MALACHITE.NOUN}}鉱石から製錬することもできます。銅には多くの用途があり、特に貨幣の材料として使われていますが、武器の材料としては強度が足りません。

ENGLISH: The king of metals. Although it is not the rarest or most valuable, gold is the most coveted metal by most races – particularly dwarves.
JAPANESE: あらゆる金属の王です。最も希少で価値があるわけではありませんが、金はほとんどの種族が最も欲する金属です。ドワーフは特に。

ENGLISH: It is a poor military which does not have access to iron. Dwarven metalsmiths know the secrets of working this into {{METAL.STEEL.NOUN}}.
JAPANESE: 鉄の武器さえ用意できないならまともな戦士とは呼べません。ドワーフの金属職人は鉄を{{METAL.STEEL.NOUN}}に加工する秘密を知っています。

ENGLISH: A silver-white metal that is highly resistant to corrosion. Platinum is rarer and therefore more valuable than {{METAL.GOLD.NOUN}}.
JAPANESE: 白銀色の腐食にとても強い金属です。プラチナは{{METAL.GOLD.NOUN}}よりも希少性が高く、高い価値を持ちます。

ENGLISH: Iron turns to rust when exposed to rain for a long period. Eventually this will decay completely!
JAPANESE: 鉄は長い間雨にさらされると錆び、最終的には完全に使用不能になります。

ENGLISH: Like {{METAL.GOLD.NOUN}}, silver is often used for coinage and as solid bars for the trading of wealth.
JAPANESE: 銀は{{METAL.GOLD.NOUN}}と同じく、貨幣や取引用のインゴットとしてよく使われます。

ENGLISH: Far stronger than {{METAL.IRON.NOUN}} which makes for superior weapons and tools, only the dwarves know the secret of creating steel.
JAPANESE: {{METAL.IRON.NOUN}}よりもはるかに強く、優れた武器や道具を作ることができます。鋼を作る秘密を知っているのはドワーフだけです。

ENGLISH: A fire has broken out in your settlement!
JAPANESE: 入植地で火災が発生しました！

ENGLISH: You have over-fished the river to such an extent that there are no more fish left. You will have to wait until the spawning season next spring for the fish to return.
JAPANESE: 捕りすぎた結果、川に魚がいなくなってしまいました。魚が戻ってくるまでには、産卵期である来年の春まで待つ必要があります。

ENGLISH: All things must come to an end. Your settlement lies abandoned.
JAPANESE: すべてが終わりました。あなたの入植地はもはや放棄されています。

ENGLISH: The prosperity of your settlement has attracted a number of new immigrants to boost your population.
JAPANESE: あなたの入植地が繁栄していると聞いて、移民が到着しました。入植地の人口が増加します。

ENGLISH: A raiding party of orcs has arrived. Prepare yourselves! They will attack after preparing for a while.
An area has caved in due to a lack of pillars and supports.
JAPANESE: 柱や支柱がないために、洞窟の一部で落盤が発生しました。

ENGLISH: An item or piece of furniture has been destroyed due to prolonged exposure to rain.\nSome materials such as iron and steel should not be left outside for a long period.
JAPANESE: 長期に渡って雨に晒された結果、建築物が壊れてしまいました。\n鉄や鋼のようないくつかの素材は、長期間屋外に放置すべきではありません。

ENGLISH: A roof has collapsed due to a lack of pillars and supports.
JAPANESE: 柱や支柱がないために、屋根が崩れてしまいました。

ENGLISH: The gruelling hardship has proven to be too much to handle for {{character}}.
JAPANESE: 次々と襲いかかる苦難が{{character}}の心を押しつぶしてしまいました。

ENGLISH: {{character}} has become so unhappy that they are throwing a tantrum!
JAPANESE: {{character}}はあまりにも不幸を感じたため、やけになってかんしゃくを起こしています！

ENGLISH: They are heading to your Trading Depot to buy and sell goods.
You must construct a Trading Depot to buy and sell goods.
Bauxite is the primary ore of aluminium. Unfortunately, a means of aluminium production is yet to be discovered.
JAPANESE: ボーキサイトはアルミニウムの原料です。 残念ながら、アルミニウム生産の手段はまだ発見されていません。

ENGLISH: This can be converted into {{ORE.COKE.NOUN}} using a {{FURNITURE.COKE_OVEN}}.
JAPANESE: {{FURNITURE.COKE_OVEN}}を使って {{ORE.COKE.NOUN}}に変換することができます。

ENGLISH: An ore that can be smelted to produce {{METAL.TIN.NOUN}}.
JAPANESE: 製錬することで{{METAL.TIN.NOUN}}を得られる鉱石です。

ENGLISH: Often confused with turquoise, it is actually an ore of {{METAL.COPPER}}.
JAPANESE: ターコイズとよく間違われますが、実際には一種の{{METAL.COPPER}}鉱石です。

ENGLISH: A refined form of {{ORE.BITUMINOUS_COAL}} which can be used as {{FUEL.SACK}}.
JAPANESE: {{ORE.BITUMINOUS_COAL}}の不純物を取り除き、{{FUEL.SACK}}としてより効果的にしたものです。

ENGLISH: An ore that can be smelted to produce {{METAL.SILVER}}.
JAPANESE: 製錬することで{{METAL.SILVER}}を得られる鉱石です。

ENGLISH: An ore that can be smelted to produce {{METAL.IRON}}.
JAPANESE: 製錬することで{{METAL.IRON}}を得られる鉱石です。

ENGLISH: Ilmenite is the primary ore of titanium. Unfortunately, a means of titanium production is yet to be discovered.
JAPANESE: イルメナイトはチタンの原料です。 残念ながら、チタン生産の手段はまだ発見されていません。

ENGLISH: An ore that can be smelted to produce {{METAL.COPPER}}.
JAPANESE: 製錬することで{{METAL.COPPER}}を得られる鉱石です。

ENGLISH: Naturally-occuring {{METAL.COPPER}} which must be smelted before use.
JAPANESE: 自然界に存在する{{METAL.COPPER}}です。金属加工に用いるには、まず製錬する必要があります。

ENGLISH: Naturally-occuring {{METAL.GOLD}} which must be smelted before use.
JAPANESE: 自然界に存在する{{METAL.GOLD}}です。金属加工に用いるには、まず製錬する必要があります。

ENGLISH: Naturally-occuring {{METAL.PLATINUM}} which must be smelted before use.
JAPANESE: 自然界に存在する{{METAL.PLATINUM}}です。金属加工に用いるには、まず製錬する必要があります。

ENGLISH: Naturally-occuring {{METAL.SILVER}} which must be smelted before use.
JAPANESE: 自然界に存在する{{METAL.SILVER}}です。金属加工に用いるには、まず製錬する必要があります。

ENGLISH: Pollucite is an ore of Caesium, which is currently too dangerous to produce. Particularly crazy dwarven metalsmiths are currently trying to find a reliable method of production.
JAPANESE: ポルサイトはセシウムを含有する鉱石であり、現在の技術で扱うにはあまりにも危険です。特に命知らずなドワーフ技術者の幾人かは、この鉱石の信頼できる加工方法を研究しています。

ENGLISH: Also known as Pyrite, its pale-yellow appearance causes some to mistake it for gold. It has several uses when crushed, but care must be taken as it sparks when struck.
JAPANESE: その澄んだ黄色のために"愚か者の金"と言われているものの、またの名は黄鉄鉱です。粉砕することでいくつかの用途に使えますが、飛び散る火花に注意する必要があります。

ENGLISH: A silvery metallic ore which turns black when exposed to air. It is strangely warm to the touch.
JAPANESE: 空気にさらされると黒くなる銀色の鉱石です。奇妙なことに、触ると暖かみを感じます。

ENGLISH: A metallic ore which complicates the smelting of tin. It has too high a melting point to be smelted with normal processes.
JAPANESE: スズ鉱石の不純物として、精錬を妨げることから嫌われている物質です。融点がきわめて高く通常の方法では加工できません。

ENGLISH: • The version of the game client
• The status of the game at the time of the crash
Mountaincore is in active development. To help diagnose and fix bugs, please click "I Accept" below to send anonymous crash reports automatically. \n\nThis is made up of only the following data:

JAPANESE: レポートを無効にする

ENGLISH: A large block of metal used to hammer heated metal into shape. Required to construct a {{FURNITURE.FORGE}}.
JAPANESE: 熱した金属をハンマーで叩いて形を作る、大きな金属のかたまりです。{{FURNITURE.FORGE}}に必要です。

ENGLISH: Metal hoops used to construct a {{PRODUCT.BARREL.NOUN}}. Also used in some machinery.
JAPANESE: {{PRODUCT.BARREL.NOUN}}を作るのに使われる金属製の輪です。他にもいくつかの機械が必要とします。

ENGLISH: Curved wooden planks used to construct a {{PRODUCT.BARREL.NOUN}}.
JAPANESE: {{PRODUCT.BARREL.NOUN}}を作るために使われる、湾曲した木板です。

ENGLISH: A cylindrical container for liquids. The curved shape makes it easier to roll around.
JAPANESE: 液体を入れることができる円筒形の容器です。側面が膨らんでいるのは、そのほうが横にした時に転がしやすいからです。

NOTES: A bowl for eating from
E.g. “Bowl of vegetable soup”

ENGLISH: A mix of ingredients that can be baked into {{PRODUCT.BREAD.LOAF.PLURAL}} using an {{FURNITURE.BAKING_OVEN}}.

NOTES: Translations incorrect and need fixing
Translations incorrect and need fixing

JAPANESE: 美味しく焼けたパンです。いつでも食べられます！

ENGLISH: A small container used to move liquids around by hand.
JAPANESE: 手に持って液体を運ぶことができる小型の容器です。

NOTES: A large metal pot for cooking (common with Halloween)

ENGLISH: Used by a {{PROFESSION.CHEF}} to prepare soup in a {{ROOMS.KITCHEN}}, where it is then moved to a {{ROOMS.FEASTING_HALL}}.
JAPANESE: {{PROFESSION.CHEF}}が{{ROOMS.KITCHEN}}でスープを作るために使います。また、そのまま{{ROOMS.FEASTING_HALL}}に持ち運ぶこともできます。

ENGLISH: Used to store coins for trading.
A roll of fabric, primarily used for bedding.
This is a metal container used to store liquids, which must be crafted at the {{FURNITURE.FORGE}}.
JAPANESE: 液体を保存するための金属製の容器です。{{FURNITURE.FORGE}}で製作します。

ENGLISH: Two large stone discs that are ground together to mill harvested crops. Used to construct a {{FURNITURE.FLOUR_MILL}}.
JAPANESE: 収穫した作物を粉にするために必要な、大きな石の円盤をふたつ重ね合わせたものです。{{FURNITURE.FLOUR_MILL}}の建設に使用します。

ENGLISH: A mix of ingredients that can be baked into {{PRODUCT.RATION.LOAF.PLURAL}} using an {{FURNITURE.BAKING_OVEN}}.
These will last a long time to feed your settlers, but you will need other sources of food as a priority.
JAPANESE: これらは長期にわたって入植者のとりあえずの食料として使えますが、しかし他の食料源を確保することを優先した方がよいでしょう。

ENGLISH: Used in the construction of mechanisms.
JAPANESE: 器械設備の構築に用いられます。

ENGLISH: Used for liquids to flow between tiles underground.
JAPANESE: タイルの地下に水などの液体を流すために使います。

ENGLISH: Used to connect mechanisms which produce and require power.
JAPANESE: 動力源と動力を必要とする設備を結ぶために使います。

ENGLISH: Used to connect mechanisms which produce and require power.
JAPANESE: 動力源と動力を必要とする設備を結ぶために使います。

ENGLISH: Crafts items using metal and also produces metal from ore.
JAPANESE: 鉱石を製錬して金属にし、金属を材料にしてアイテムを作ります。
木製の家具やアイテムを作成します。

ENGLISH: Prepares all of the food to be consumed by your settlers.
JAPANESE: 入植者たちの食を一手に担います。
作物を植え、害虫から守り、収穫します。

NOTES: This could be “fisherman” and “fisherwoman”

ENGLISH: Catches fish from bodies of water for use as food and resources.
JAPANESE: 水中から魚を捕まえ、食料や資源として活用します。

NOTES: This could be “huntsman” and “huntress”

ENGLISH: Tracks and kills wild animals for their meat and pelts.
JAPANESE: 肉や皮を得るために野生動物を追い、殺します。

ENGLISH: Treats the hides of creatures to produce leather goods.

NOTES: In English at least, “mayoress” is incorrect
Not a fully implemented profession, just used to describe “Milling flour”

ENGLISH: Nobles do not fulfil jobs in the same way as common settlers, but bring fame and prestige to your settlement.
JAPANESE: 貴族は平民の入植者と同様の労働を行いませんが、あなたの入植地に名声と威信をもたらします。

NOTES: from “runes” and “blacksmith”
This is an invented term for the game, but should be derived

ENGLISH: Enchants weapons, armour and items with magical runes to boost their abilities.
JAPANESE: 武器、防具、その他のアイテムに魔法のルーンでエンチャントを施し、それらを強化します。
エンチャントしている

ENGLISH: An absolute beginner with little to no experience.
They only understand the basics of their craft.
Though they are becoming skilled, there is still a lot of experience to be earned.
No longer an apprentice, they have reasonable skill in their given craft.
They are well-skilled but still have further heights that can be reached.
Very skilled in their craft, they are now more than competent.
There is little that the expert does not know of their respective field.
Beyond even an expert, they are truly a master of their craft.
There is nobody more skilled in their craft than a grandmaster.
Crafts furniture and items from stone.
JAPANESE: 石から建築物やアイテムを作ります。

ENGLISH: This settler does not have any specific professions and will fulfil any mundane tasks like hauling items.
JAPANESE: この入植者は特定の役割を持ちませんが、アイテムを運搬するなどの誰でもできるような仕事を果たします。

ENGLISH: Processes materials into clothing and other fabrics.

NOTES: This could be “lumberjack” and “lumberjane”

ENGLISH: Cuts down trees as lumber that can be used in a {{ROOMS.SAWMILL}}.
JAPANESE: 木を伐採し、{{ROOMS.SAWMILL}}で使用できる木材にします。

ENGLISH: A deer is a non-threatening herbivore which will flee at any sign of danger
JAPANESE: シカは無害な草食動物です。危険を察知すると逃亡します。

NOTES: The male and female forms are only for languages that need them
Note that I'm going with Tolkein's spelling of “dwarves” rather than “dwarfs”

ENGLISH: Dwarves are short and stocky humanoids. They are masters of working with stone and metal. Most dwarves distrust the sky and prefer to stay underground.
JAPANESE: ドワーフは背が低く、がっしりとした体型の亜人種です。石や金属の加工に長けています。ほとんどのドワーフは空の下にいることを喜ばず、また好んで地下に潜ります。

NOTES: Orcs are only male

ENGLISH: Grain that has been milled into a fine powder ready to be used as an ingredient in the production of food.
JAPANESE: 穀粉は食品として利用するために粉末にされた穀物です。

ENGLISH: A hunk of rock containing gems ready to be cut and polished.
JAPANESE: 宝石の混ざった岩石の塊です。カットしたり磨いたりする必要があります。

ENGLISH: Sections of a tree that are most commonly prepared into {{RESOURCE.PLANKS.PLURAL}}, but have other uses as well.
JAPANESE: {{RESOURCE.PLANKS.PLURAL}}の材料となる丸太です。あるいは加工せず使われることもあります。

ENGLISH: A lump of metal mixed with slag which must be hammered into a usable form.
JAPANESE: 不純物の混じった金属のかたまりです。何かに利用するには、鍛冶台で叩いて不純物を取り除く必要があります。

ENGLISH: Refined metal blocks, ready to be used as a crafting ingredient.
JAPANESE: 精錬された金属のかたまりです。アイテムの材料として使用できます。

ENGLISH: Large, flat plates that are used in some of the larger machinery.
JAPANESE: 大型器械の建材として使われる、大きな板金です。

ENGLISH: A log that has been infused with {{INGREDIENT.MUSHROOM.SPAWN.NOUN}}. The body of the log itself is where the mushrooms draw nutrients from. It requires dousing in a {{FURNITURE.MUSHROOM_SHOCK_TANK}} after becoming fully innoculated.
JAPANESE: 原木に{{INGREDIENT.MUSHROOM.SPAWN.NOUN}}を注入したものです。原木はキノコの栄養分になります。注入後、キノコの発生を促すには一度{{FURNITURE.MUSHROOM_SHOCK_TANK}}に浸す必要があります。

ENGLISH: Sections of a giant mushroom that can be used in the same way as wooden {{RESOURCE.LOGS.PLURAL}}.
JAPANESE: {{RESOURCE.LOGS.PLURAL}}と同じように使用できる巨大キノコの茎です。

ENGLISH: A metallic sand created by breaking down raw metal ore, ready for use in a {{FURNITURE.BLOOMERY_FURNACE}}.
JAPANESE: 金属成分の混ざった岩を砕いて砂利ほどの大きにしたもので、{{FURNITURE.BLOOMERY_FURNACE}}に投入することができます。

ENGLISH: Stone that contains metallic ores which can be processed into usable metal.
JAPANESE: 金属成分を含んだ岩です。加工することで金属として利用できるようになります。

ENGLISH: Sections of wood of a fixed size so they can be easily used in constructions and crafting.
JAPANESE: 建築や工作に使うために、均一な寸法に切りそろえられた木材です。

ENGLISH: This mushroom-infused log has been “shocked” in water to encourage the mushrooms to develop and should produce a harvest soon.
JAPANESE: この原木は外部からの刺激でキノコの発生を促すために水に漬けられており、収穫期が早まります。

ENGLISH: Stone that has been shaped into a cube so that it can be easily used in construction or crafting.
JAPANESE: 建築や工作に使いやすいよう、キューブ状に切り分けられた石です。

ENGLISH: A huge piece of stone that must be chiselled into a more useful shape by a {{PROFESSION.STONEMASON}}.
JAPANESE: 巨大な石です。何かに利用するには{{PROFESSION.STONEMASON}}で石材に整えなければなりません。

ENGLISH: Sacks of wheat are harvested from farm plots sown with wheat seeds.
Weapons and armour are created here.
JAPANESE: 武器や防具を作成します。

ENGLISH: Where bread dough is created and then baked into bread.
A place for members of the military to sleep and train.
A place for your settlers to sleep.
JAPANESE: 入植者たちが寝る場所です。最低でも9タイル、できれば13タイル以上の大きさの寝室を持つことを彼らは期待しています。

ENGLISH: Brews beer for your settlers to enjoy!
JAPANESE: ビールを醸造し、入植者に楽しみを提供します。将来的には他のアルコール飲料にも対応する予定です。

ENGLISH: Placed across the river to allow access to the other side.
JAPANESE: 川の反対側に渡れるようにします。

ENGLISH: This workshop produces most wooden tools and items
JAPANESE: 木材から道具やその他のアイテムを生産する場所です。
全{{total}}タイル中{{allocated}}タイルを使用中

ENGLISH: Grows crops using {{INGREDIENT.SEEDS.PLURAL}}. Must be placed on {{MATERIAL_TYPE.EARTH.NOUN}}.
JAPANESE: {{INGREDIENT.SEEDS.PLURAL}}を使って作物を育てます。{{MATERIAL_TYPE.EARTH.NOUN}}の上でなければなりません。

ENGLISH: A place for settlers to gather to eat, drink and be merry!
JAPANESE: 入植者たちが食べ、飲み、騒ぐための場所です！

ENGLISH: Deceased settlers are laid to rest here.
JAPANESE: 死せる入植者たちに安息の眠りを提供する場所です。

ENGLISH: Most food is prepared here before being served in a {{ROOMS.FEASTING_HALL}}.
JAPANESE: {{ROOMS.FEASTING_HALL}}で提供する食事を作る場所です。

ENGLISH: Craft items out of animal hide.
This workshop produces most items made out of stone.
JAPANESE: 石を加工してアイテムを生産する場所です。

ENGLISH: Mushrooms can be grown using {{INGREDIENT.MUSHROOM.SPAWN.NOUN}} and wooden {{RESOURCE.LOGS.PLURAL}}.
JAPANESE: キノコを育て、収穫する場所です。栽培には{{INGREDIENT.MUSHROOM.SPAWN.NOUN}}や{{RESOURCE.LOGS.PLURAL}}が必要です。
{{RESOURCE.LOGS.PLURAL}}を{{RESOURCE.PLANKS.PLURAL}}などの材料に加工する場所です。

ENGLISH: Metallic ore is refined into usable ingots here.
This area stores different kinds of items depending on settings.
JAPANESE: このエリアには、設定に応じてさまざまな種類のアイテムを置くことができます。

ENGLISH: Unused items are placed in stockpiles for easy access.
JAPANESE: 使わないものを後で取り出しやすい場所に保管します。

ENGLISH: Processes {{SEED.HEMP_SEED}} into textiles for a variety of uses.
JAPANESE: {{SEED.HEMP_SEED}}を色々な用途に使える繊維に加工します。

ENGLISH: Buy and sell items with visiting merchants.

NOTES: Just to describe a light colour

ENGLISH: These are the remains of an item that has completed corroded due to rust.
JAPANESE: 錆びて使用できなくなったアイテムの残骸です。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.BARLEY.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: A grain used only in the production of beer. Can be planted in {{SEASON.SPRING}}, {{SEASON.SUMMER}} or {{SEASON.AUTUMN}}.
JAPANESE: ビールの製造にのみ利用できる穀物です。植えられる時期は{{SEASON.SPRING}}、{{SEASON.SUMMER}}および{{SEASON.AUTUMN}}です。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.BERSERKER_MUSHROOM.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: A mushroom with a pink-red cap bearing white spots. It has hallucinogenic properties which warriors sometimes use in preparation for battle.
JAPANESE: ピンク色の傘に白い斑点のあるキノコです。幻覚作用があり、戦士が戦いの前に使う薬物として用いられます。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.CARROT.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: A hardy root vegetable that survives the {{SEASON.WINTER}} frost. Carrots grow quickly but only produce a small crop. Can be planted in {{SEASON.SPRING}}, {{SEASON.SUMMER}} or {{SEASON.AUTUMN}}.
JAPANESE: ニンジンは{{SEASON.WINTER}}の霜にも耐える丈夫な根菜です。成長が早いものの少量しか収穫できません。植え付け時期は{{SEASON.SPRING}}、{{SEASON.SUMMER}}および{{SEASON.AUTUMN}}です。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.CORN.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: A cereal grain also known as maize. It produces a bountiful crop but takes around 2 seasons to grow and can not survive {{SEASON.WINTER}}, so it requires planting in early {{SEASON.SPRING}}.
JAPANESE: トウモロコシからは豊かな収穫が得られます。しかし栽培には2季節かかり、{{SEASON.WINTER}}の寒さには耐えられないので、{{SEASON.SPRING}}の早い時期に植え付ける必要があります。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.DEATH_CAP_MUSHROOM.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: A very poisonous mushroom with a wide, flat cap. Eating even a tiny amount will almost certainly cause poisoning which can lead to death.
JAPANESE: 幅広で平らな傘を持つ猛毒のキノコです。少し食べればほぼ確実に中毒を起こし、死に至ります。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.ELFSBANE_MUSHROOM.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: This mushroom has a simple, flavourless taste to most humanoids. Strangely, it tastes absolutely disgusting to elves, who often react with explosive vomiting upon consumption, or in extreme cases, a heart attack.
JAPANESE: このキノコは、ほとんどの人間と亜人間にとっては味のないただのキノコです。不思議なことにエルフには生理的に受け付けない味で、食べると凄い勢いで嘔吐しますし、ひどい場合には心臓発作を起こすこともあります。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.FIST_MUSHROOM.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: A black-blue mushroom with a metallic taste. It is named for a group of bards from the age of darkness.
JAPANESE: ヘビーでメタリックな味がする、黒と青のキノコです。暗黒の時代には、この名前を冠した吟遊詩人の一団がいたと言われています。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.GLOW_MUSHROOM.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: A magic-infused mushroom that gives off light and changes colour with the seasons.
JAPANESE: ひとりでに光を放ち、しかも季節ごとに色が変わる不思議なキノコです。

ENGLISH: Used to produce rope and fabric after it hsa been processed.
JAPANESE: ロープや布地の製造に利用できる植物です。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.HOPS.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: A flower used for the flavouring of beer. Must be planted in {{SEASON.SPRING}}.
JAPANESE: ビールの香り付けに使われる花です。植えるのは{{SEASON.SPRING}}でなければなりません。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.MILTONIA_MUSHROOM.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: Once thought to exist only in the Hudds region, it is now found throughout the world.
JAPANESE: かつてはハッズ地方にしか存在しないと考えられていましたが、今では世界中で見られるようになりました。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.POTATO.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: A starchy root vegetable which can survive {{SEASON.WINTER}} making it a good choice for most settlements. Can be planted in {{SEASON.SPRING}}, {{SEASON.SUMMER}} or {{SEASON.AUTUMN}}.
JAPANESE: {{SEASON.WINTER}}を越すことができるデンプン質が豊富な根菜で、ほとんどの入植地で栽培に適しています。{{SEASON.SPRING}}、{{SEASON.SUMMER}}もしくは{{SEASON.AUTUMN}}に植えられます。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.PURPLE_HELMET_MUSHROOM.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: Fat Hat, Plump Turban, Puffy Helmet; This fabled mushroom goes by many names. Legend holds that long ago, many communities of dwarves subsisted entirely on a domesticated strain of this fungus.
JAPANESE: ふとっちょ帽子、ぽっこりターバン、ふわふわ兜…このキノコは色々な愛称で呼ばれます。伝説によれば遠い昔、多くのドワーフの集落が栽培されたこのキノコだけで食を賄っていたということです。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.ROCIOMYCOTA_MUSHROOM.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: A white and black spotted mushroom. It has been known to affect the appearance of those who ingest it.
JAPANESE: 白と黒の斑点があるキノコです。食べた人の容姿に影響を与える作用があることが知られています。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.SUNGLOW_MUSHROOM.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: A bright yellow mushroom which glows with the appearance of sunlight. It loses this glow the moment it is harvested.
JAPANESE: 太陽の光を浴びて輝く明るい黄色のキノコです。 収穫された瞬間に輝きは失われます。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.SYRUP_POWDER_MUSHROOM.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: A round orange/yellow mushroom with a white underside. It is said to have been used by mages long ago, but for what purpose, nobody knows.
JAPANESE: 表はオレンジや黄色、裏側は白い丸いキノコです。遠い昔には魔術師が使っていたと言われています。何のために使っていたのかまでは伝わっていませんが。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.TOMATO.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: A plant which grows large red berries often used as a vegetable. Can only be planted in {{SEASON.SPRING}}.
JAPANESE: 野菜として食べられる大きな赤い実をつける植物です。{{SEASON.SPRING}}に植えられます。

NOTES: {{VEGETABLE.WHEAT.TOOLTIP}}
ENGLISH: A cereal grain generally used for the production of bread. It can survive {{SEASON.WINTER}} but takes a while to grow, so it is either planted in {{SEASON.SPRING}} or {{SEASON.AUTUMN}}.
JAPANESE: この穀物はふつうパン作りに使われます。{{SEASON.WINTER}}でも枯れずに残りますが、生育が遅くなります。そのため{{SEASON.SPRING}}か{{SEASON.AUTUMN}}に植えられます。

An igneous rock formed by the rapid cooling of lava. Almost all of the volcanic rock in the world is basalt.
JAPANESE: 溶岩が急速に冷却されてできた火成岩です。世界中の火山の岩は、そのほとんどが玄武岩です。

ENGLISH: A sedimentary rock mostly made up of the mineral dolomite, so it is also known as dolomite rock.
JAPANESE: 主にドロマイトという鉱物でできている堆積岩で、そのためドロマイト岩とも呼ばれます。

ENGLISH: A blue-hued rock mostly found on an icy island to the north. It has a high iron content.
JAPANESE: 閃青岩は主に北方の氷に閉ざされた島で産出される青みがかった岩石です。鉄分を多く含んでいます。

ENGLISH: A common type of igneous rock. It has a large proportion of quartz, making it good for locating certain gemstones.
JAPANESE: よくある火成岩です。石英の割合が多く、特定の宝石を探すのに適しています。

ENGLISH: A lightly-coloured sedimentary rock which makes for a good building material. It is also used as a flux in the production of {{METAL.STEEL.NOUN}}.
JAPANESE: 淡い色をした堆積岩で、建築材料に適しています。また、{{METAL.STEEL.NOUN}}を製造する際の融剤としても使われます。

ENGLISH: A metamorphic rock which is used as a high-quality material for sculpture and masonry due to its brilliant appearance.
JAPANESE: この変成岩は美しい外観のため、彫刻や石細工に最適な素材として珍重されます。

ENGLISH: A sedimentary rock composed of sand-like fragments.
JAPANESE: 砂のような断片からなる堆積岩です。

ENGLISH: A fine-grained sedimentary rock composed of pressurized mud. It can be easily broken into thin layers.
JAPANESE: 加圧された泥からなる細粒の堆積岩です。ページをめくるように、簡単に薄い層に分けることができます。

ENGLISH: A metamorphic rock that is usually formed out of {{STONE.SHALE.NOUN}}. It is often made into tiles for roofing or writing.
JAPANESE: 通常{{STONE.SHALE.NOUN}}から形成される変成岩です。屋根や文字を書くための黒板としてよく使われます。

ENGLISH: Used to chop down trees. The primary tool of a {{PROFESSION.WOODCUTTER}}.
JAPANESE: 木を切り倒すのに使います。{{PROFESSION.WOODCUTTER}}に必要な道具です。

ENGLISH: Used to sculpt rock into shape. One of the tools used by a {{PROFESSION.STONEMASON}}.
JAPANESE: 岩石を彫り、形を整えるのに用います。{{PROFESSION.STONEMASON}}が使う道具のひとつです。

ENGLISH: Used to catch fish from a body of water. The primary tool of a {{PROFESSION.FISHER}}.
JAPANESE: 魚を釣るために使います。{{PROFESSION.FISHER}}が持つべきものです。

ENGLISH: Used to prepare food, particularly meat.
JAPANESE: 食材、特に肉を調理する際に使います。

ENGLISH: Used to bash large items of stone and metal into shape. The primary tool of a {{PROFESSION.BLACKSMITH}}.
JAPANESE: 石や金属などの大きなものを叩いて形を整えるのに使います。{{PROFESSION.BLACKSMITH}}の仕事道具です。

ENGLISH: Used to break stone into smaller pieces. The primary tool of a {{PROFESSION.MiNER}}.
JAPANESE: 岩を砕くのに使います。 {{PROFESSION.MiNER}}の持ち物です。

ENGLISH: This covers the basics of playing.
You should aim to set up a functioning {{ROOMS.SMITHY}} with a {{FURNITURE.FORGE}} provided with fuel and refined metal ore, to produce metal items.
Also, you should move your settlement underground or at least build a roof overhead to protect your Settlers and iron items from the weather.
Rooms with furniture that produce items are controlled using Import and Export Pallets.
Place at least one Import Pallet and Export Pallet in both the Sawmill and Masonry Workshop.
Also, place a Products Stockpile which will hold the items that are produced.
Select each Import and Export Pallet and select the item to be imported or exported from the room.
In the Sawmill, import Logs and export Planks.
In the Masonry Workshop, import Rough stone boulders and export Blocks.
Are you sure you want to end the tutorial?
Click on Rooms and select Farm Plot. They are listed alphabetically.
Drag out 4 separate Farm Plots in a grassy area.
Click on each Farm Plot and select a Crop to be planted.
Press R2 on each Farm Plot and select a Crop to be planted.
Skip Hemp, Barley and Hops for now as these are are used for Textiles and Brewing.
Settlers eat in the Feasting Hall.
The Cauldron furniture for the Feasting Hall is only completed when a Cauldron containing soup is available.
Select Rooms and place a Feasting Hall. Mark a Cauldron to be placed in the Feasting Hall later.
This simple setup will ensure your Settlers have food once the crops are harvested later in the year.
You can also fish from the river or hunt animals once you have set up a military to provide more food.
Crops are harvested in Autumn and should be stored in a Food Stockpile.
To get the most from your crops it is best to produce soup from vegetables or bake bread from grain.
Select Rooms and place a Kitchen. Unlike Farm Plots, most rooms need furniture to function.
The controls in the lower-left corner of the screen are the main way of interacting with the game.
You can assign orders, queue rooms and furniture to be created, and also adjust the priority of tasks.
You can right-click to go back to a previous menu or clear the current selection.
You can press L2 to go back to a previous menu or clear the current selection.
The icons to the left of the time and date are various management and overview screens.
Click on the Minimap to jump to a location
Press R2 with the cursor on the Minimap to jump to a location
Settlers need Food, Drink and Sleep.
For now they can drink from the river and sleep on the ground.
However to eat they must grow crops.
Each Settler can have up to 3 Professions assigned, which determines which jobs they will do.
You can select a Settler to view or change their professions. This can also be done from the Settlers Management screen.
Assign at least 3 Settlers as Farmers. Be sure to also keep some assigned as Haulers as they're responsible for moving items around.

NOTES: Used to show a progress indicator for how many farm plots have a crop selected e.g. 2 of 10 farm plots with a crop assigned
JAPANESE: 箇所の作物の割り当てられた{{ROOMS.FARM.PLURAL}}

NOTES: Used to show a progress indicator for how many of a certain profession have been assigned e.g. 2 of 10 farmers assigned

ENGLISH: Many items are crafted out of Wooden Planks and Stone Blocks. It's important to maintain a steady supply of these.
Select Orders > Mine. Drag a selection over the mountain area to order your Miners to start mining.
Also select Orders > Chop. Drag a selection over a forested area to order your Woodcutters to start chopping trees.
With all of this in place, your workshops will start producing Wooden Planks and Stone Blocks.
Continue until you have a reasonable supply of Planks and Blocks.
Progress is saved automatically at midnight or when you exit the game.
JAPANESE: 進行状況は深夜に自動的に保存され、ゲームを終了したときにも保存されます。F5キーを押してクイックセーブすることもできます。

ENGLISH: Progress is saved automatically at midnight each day.
You can also press F5 to Quicksave.
The game is also saved when you quit from the main menu.
Press the WASD keys to move the camera around
Use the Left Stick or D-Pad to move the camera around
Press Q & E or scroll the mouse wheel to zoom
Press L1 and R1 to zoom in and out
Welcome to Mountaincore! This is an Early Access release with gameplay and features still in development.

Your intrepid band of dwarven settlers have chosen this area to found a new colony of their kingdom. Provide food, shelter and prosperity for them and who knows, maybe one day this will be the capital of a kingdom of its own!
It is a good idea to place Stockpiles for your Settlers to place and share items.
Select Rooms and then select Stockpile, then Tools. Drag out a Tools Stockpile in a central location.
You can view the current time, date, weather and control the game's speed here.
Click the icons or press buttons 2, 3 and 4 for increasingly faster speeds
Press R2 on the icons for increasingly faster speeds
Click the icon or press 1 for normal speed
Press R2 over the icon for normal speed
Press space to pause and unpause the game
Press the A button to pause and unpause the game
Click the left-most button to return to the default view mode
Press R2 on the left-most icon to return to the default view mode
Below the time and date are buttons to show different views overlaid onto the game world.
Click one of the other view mode buttons
Press R2 over one of the other view mode buttons
Wooden Planks are produced in a Sawmill by a Woodcutter. Stone Blocks are created in a Masonry Workshop by a Stonemason.
Select Rooms and place a Sawmill and a Masonry Workshop. They both require a crafting station to be constructed.
